title: TUC Rejects Utility Tariff Hikes
text:
20 October 2015 08:59 CET TUC Rejects Utility Tariff Hikes By Daily Guide 
Kofi Asamoah, Secretary-General of the Ghana Trades Union Congress (TUC), has stated that owing to the plight of workers, his outfit will not accept a 400 percent increment in electricity and water tariffs proposed by utility providers recently. 
The utility companies on Friday, October 16, 2015, at a meeting with the TUC made a strong argument for increases in tariffs and said without that they could not be in operation. 
Kofi Asamoah – TUC BossWhile the Electricity Company of Ghana (ECG) was calling for tariff to be increased from GH14p per kilowatt hour to GH30p, the Ghana Water Company Limited (GWCL) called for the price of 5 barrels of water to be increased from GH¢1.78p to GH¢4. 
However, the TUC explained that despite the demand for increases in tariffs, workers would not accept that. 
Mr Asamoah argued that Ghanaian workers had been saddled with a lot of economic problems for which reason they could not accept the tariff increases. 
At a press conference over the weekend, he said utility companies did a technical justification but that was only a means to an end, adding that workers were facing similar challenges just like the service providers. 
Among the challenges cited by the service companies was the depreciation of the cedi against major currencies. 
The Secretary General emphasised that the TUC was going to deliberate on all the issues presented by the utility companies and react to them. 
'We will not accept the levels that they are proposing.' 
By Samuel Boadi
